subhed: The president avoided reviewing his record, simply assuring that France 'is holding firm.' While he outlined three major projects for 2026 – voluntary national service, digital majority at age 15, and end-of-life care – he seems to have implicitly acknowledged his own powerlessness.

subhed: Hiring women or men of short stature to 'spice up' parties has become increasingly common in Europe in recent years. These practices raise both moral and legal questions.

title: Taiwanese president vows to defend sovereignty in New Year's speech
subhed: 'My stance has always been clear: to steadfastly defend national sovereignty, strengthen national defense and whole-of-society resilience,'  Lai Ching-te said. His speech comes amidst Chinese military drills this week around the self-ruled island and a domestic political crisis.

title: Early Christian fresco depicting Jesus as the Good Shepherd discovered in Turkey
subhed: One month after Pope Leo XIV's visit, Turkish authorities announced the discovery in Iznik, Anatolia, of a depiction of Christ in a well-preserved burial chamber.

title: Bulgaria joins the euro divided, in political crisis and without a budget
subhed: The Balkan country adopted the European single currency on January 1, but the population remains unenthusiastic. The country only has a caretaker government and corruption is endemic.

title: Online gambling companies zero in on France's disadvantaged neighborhoods
New Year's Eve 2015 in Cologne: The night that traumatized thousands of women and shook Germany
subhed: On New Year's Eve in 2015, more than 1,000 women were sexually assaulted in Cologne by groups of men, many from North Africa and the Middle East, triggering a fierce debate over Germany's refugee policy. Ten years on, victims say their trauma was politicized, as they continue to live with the consequences of that night.

title: Brigitte Bardot's 30 years of sympathy for the far right
subhed: Convicted five times for racist remarks, the actress – whose foundation announced her death on Sunday, December 28 – remained one of the only French celebrities to openly embrace far-right views.

title: Europe's dramatic decline in pharmaceutical production threatens health sovereignty
subhed: The rise of China and India, combined with protectionist pressure from the Trump administration, is redrawing the global map of the pharmaceutical industry. The Europe-wide deindustrialization that began in the 2000s is now accelerating.
